servinfo.title: Side-Air Bag (Inflator) Module Removal and Installation

item.ptxt: Never attempt to disassemble or repair the side-air bag (inflator) module. If any abnormality is found, be sure to replace it with new one as an assembly.

Be sure to read Precautions on Service and Diagnosis of Air Bag System , Precautions on Handling and Storage of Air Bag System Components and Precautions on Disposal of Air Bag and Seat Belt Pretensioner before starting to work and observe every precaution during work. Neglecting them may result in personal injury or undeployment of the air bag when necessary.

s1.ptxt: Disable air bag system. Refer to Disabling Air Bag System .
Roll up the seat surface of the seat back.
Remove sleeve lock nut (1) from seat back (2).
Remove side-air bag (inflator) module from seat back.
Disconnect side-air bag (inflator) module connector (1) as shown in figure.

s2.ptxt: With lock button unlocked, disconnect connector.

item.ptxt: When carrying a live air bag (inflator) module, make sure the bag opening is pointed away from you.
Never carry air bag (inflator) module by wires or connector on the side of the module. In case of an accidental deployment, the bag will then deploy with minimal chance of injury.

As the live side-air bag (inflator) module must be kept with its bag (trim cover) facing up while being stored or left standing. This is necessary so that a free space is provided to allow the air bag to expand in the unlikely event of accidental deployment.
Observe Precautions on Handling and Storage of Air Bag System Components for handling and storing it.

attention2.ptxt: Do not damage the sleeve. Otherwise, the side-air bag cannot be correctly installed to seat back.

s1.ptxt: Confirm sleeve (1) is surely installed in side-air bag (inflator) module.
Tighten sleeve lock nut (2) to specified torque.
Install new clip to seat back.
Connect side-air bag (inflator) module connector (1) securely as shown in figure.
Insert claw (1) of side-air bag (inflator) module on installation hole (2).
Push side-air bag (inflator) module into clip (3) with specified force.
